intro: Massonia latebrosa, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to dry conditions. Massonia latebrosa is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
